snippet: Economic growth in the United States was a bit slower than initially thought in the first quarter, the Commerce Department reported.
abstract: ADP reports private employers created 133,000 jobs in May, up from 113,000 in April and below economists' expectations for a gain of 148,000; Labor Department reports initial claims for state jobless benefits rose 10,000 in the previous week to a seasonally adjusted 383,000; Commerce Department reports gross domestic product rose at a revised annual rate of 1.9 percent in the first quarter from previous estimate of 2.2 percent.
lead_paragraph: Economic growth in the United States was a bit slower than initially thought in the first quarter, the Commerce Department reported.

headline.main: Data Suggests Tepid Outlook Ahead of Jobs Report
headline.print_headline: Data Suggests Tepid Outlook Ahead of Jobs Report
